page.title: 041slip
page.content: Islip is a compact partly local limestone built village of about 600 inhabitants of whom at least 150 are old age pensioners.The village straddles the River Ray where it passes through a narrow valley to join the Cherwell.There are three farms,two pubs,a church,a chapel,a post office,one shop,and a coal merchant.A very big recreation ground opposite the church has two football pitches,a cricket pitch,swings and climbing frames and a slide for children,and a village hall.Nearby is Dr South's School where there are 42 pupils aged 5 to 11.Over the railway line from the school there is the doctors' Surgery and Health Clinic.There used to be a Station,but the railway now only carries goods.The biggest house in the village is the Old Rectory built by Dr South in 1695.
